meanings.definition: Something that actually exists; reality; truth.
meanings.sent1: The teacher shared interesting facts about animals with the class.
meanings.sent2: She always checks the facts before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The detective found the missing clue in the facts of the case.
meanings.sent4: In a world of opinions, facts shine like beacons of truth.
meanings.sent5: The facts of history are like puzzle pieces that fit together perfectly.

meanings.definition: A piece of information presented as having objective reality.
meanings.sent1: The scientist recorded the experimental facts in his notebook.
meanings.sent2: Journalists strive to report only verified facts to the public.
meanings.sent3: The facts in the research paper surprised the readers with new insights.
meanings.sent4: In court, the lawyer presented irrefutable facts to support her argument.
meanings.sent5: The facts in the report painted a clear picture of the situation.
